Noone knows for sure what this is, but it was on the PBE a few weeks ago after Illaoi's lines were leaked and before she was officially announced. It was right during the harrowing short stories.

Some believe it is Poppy's reworked VO. In a way that makes sense. It is comparable to Tristana's voice with a little more of Poppy's in-game tone to it.

The weird thing is its constant reference to "heroes" or a "hero". Since it was added to the announcer VO it is either for a new game mode, or it is a teaser for something like how Kindred gave random messages before their release. It might not be Poppy at all, but IMO it would make a really decent voice for her.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=zSvNisIDIuU

Since her rework is going to be Sion-level it is safe to assume that her lore will be considerably different, BUT it could also use some of her original lore as a base. Her original lore is already quite decent though so they could expand on it rather than remove it.

What if her job as ambassador of Bandle City was to seek out heroes to fight Noxus? Some sort of pre Noxus vs Demacia ingame event tying to Poppy's rework?

After a it finds a Lich Bane its hammer cuts HP in half.

I'm really feeling a reveal (or legitimate teaser) shortly after Illaoi goes live, which I predict will be within the next 2 or so weeks.

Poppy's relaunch, being treated in the same vein as Sion's, is being treated as entirely new champion launch. I don't think Riot want's Poppy to overshadow Illaoi's launch.

Although I would wonder if PD is still nice since it no longer works all the time.
Crit isn't that good on poppy.
Crit is her god-stat as her Q crits... FOR MAGIC DAMAGE.
You won't get much out of a crit build though, because kiting is her greatest weakness, and she doesn't need help doing dmg. She needs helps being able to catch up to do that dmg.
Crit items give move speed, and if your burst is high enough you don't get kited - enemies can't kite if they die to one Q.
5% ms doesn't do much, also they can just decide to run away if you charge toward them, and your ult ends a lot faster than people think.
